result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: DEJ Agreement
Contact with A.K. (1976) and D.T.V. (2010) only as directed by Vilas County Social Services, maintain absolute sobriety.

Defendant James Christopher Vizanko in court.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Maggie Hogan in court for James Christopher Vizanko. Deferred Entry of Judgment submitted to the Court.  Plea questionnaire filed.  Plea of no contest.  Rights given.  Court finds that defendant is knowingly and voluntarily waiving right to jury trial and plea is found to be entered knowingly and voluntarily.  Found guilty.  Deferred entry of judgment has been approved for 12 months, follow DEJ and order in the CHIPS case. Bond amended.  Case set for review/sentencing 6/8/2023 at 2:00 p.m.
DEJ Agreement
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 9, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Maintain absoulte sobriety, no contact with J.C.V. (2008), except as allowed by Social Services.  No abusive contact with B.J.V., no contact with D.T.V (2010) or A.K. (1976)

Defendant James Christopher Vizanko in court.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Maggie Hogan in court for James Christopher Vizanko. Attorney Hogan does not have her witness list.  Deadline dates set for attorneys.  Court grants motion to modify bond.  Changed to non abusive contact with B.J.V., no other changes.  Final pretrial set for June 9, 2022 at 2:30 p.m.
Final pre-trial on June 9, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
State's Motion to Admit Other Acts Evidence with Exhibits
No abusive phone contact with B.J.V.(2004) and J.C.V.(2008), no contact with D.T.V.(2010) and A.K.(1976).

Re: Bond modification.  (Called following 22JC8 and 22JC10).  Appearances by District Attorney Hayes, Attorney Maggie Hogan, James Vizanko.  Also present in courtroom are Asst. Corp. Counsel Scott Niemi, ADA Dennis Brown, GAL Morgan Tomczyk, Attorney Cana Kohn.  Hayes proposes amendment of bond to reflect non-abusive phone contact with B.V. and J.V.  States in compliance with Marcy's Law.  Hogan states PTC set for May 24, 2022; requests bond modified to allow non-abusive phone contact with B.V. and J.V., no contact with D.V. Kohn states Brody would like to have contact with his father.  Brody V. (17) states he would like non-supervised contact with his dad. Joseph V. (14) states  he agrees with Brody and wants to have contact with dad.  Hayes objects; recently received additional information.  Court modifies bond for non-abusive phone contact with B.V. and J.V., no contact with D.V.
Jury trial on June 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial on May 24, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant appears in court with Attorney Hogan by zoom. DA Hayes appears in court for the State of Wisconsin. Parties speak on status of the case and sets the matter for a final pre trial on May 24th at 9:00 am and sets a Jury trial for June 15th, 16th. bond continued. Bond conditions reiterated on the record.
signed 4-20-22
Maintain absolute sobriety ,No contact with J.C.V (2008) or B.J.V (2004) except as allowed by Social Services,  No contact with D.T.V(2010) or A.K. (1976).

8:30 AM Defendant James Christopher Vizanko in court.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Maggie Hogan appeared by video for James Christopher Vizanko.  Victim rights legislation has been complied with. Parties have had several conversations regarding a resolution of the case.  PLEAS scheduled.  State makes mention that there are reports of contact being had with parties identified in complaint. Defense notes that she has spoken with client about this. Court reiterates bond conditions and no contact provisions. Bond amended to state: Maintain absolute sobriety ,No contact with J.C.V dob 2008, B.J.V dob 2004 except as allowed by Social Services,  No contact with D.T.V dob 2010 or A.K. dob 1976.  Amended bond form

Plea/sentencing hearing on May 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

3:02 PM Defendant James Christopher Vizanko appeared by video.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Maggie Hogan appeared by video for James Christopher Vizanko.  Victim appears by video.  Victim rights legislation has been complied with. Parties have had discussions and request an additional pretrial conference.  Bond continued.
Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Judicial Pretrial - in court on April 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant appears in court with Attorney Hogan. DA Hayes appears in court for the State of Wisconsin. Victim rights legislation has been complied with. Witness sworn and testified. Hogan enters not guilty plea on behalf of her client.  Court continues no contact order; contact with older 2 children as allowed by social services.  Pre-trial conference before court April 14, 2022 at 3:00 p.m.

to Modify Bond
03-25-22 Bond Hearing Transcript

Defendant James Christopher Vizanko in court. DA Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Maggie Hogan appeared by video for James Christopher Vizanko. Attorney Hogan has received complaint and waives reading and asks for preliminary hearing. Court accepts waiver and sets preliminary hearing for April 6th at 8:30 am. bond continued. Attorney Hogan motions the court to modify bond. Court denies motion to modify at this time.

Defendant appears by video in the Vilas County Jail without counsel. DA Hayes appears in court for the State of Wisconsin. DA Hayes request to play audio recording. Court accepts. States exhibit 1 CD, will be received by court and stored with the Clerk of Courts, makes findings of probable cause. Court orders $5,000 signature bond. Conditions, Maintain absolute sobriety  no contact with J.C.V dob 2008, B.J.V dob 2004, D.T.V dob 2010, A.K. dob 1976. Court sets initial appearance to March 29th at 9:30 am.
